instruction: What is the role of NonEW C[2] JUs in the EW Network PG and EW control function?
input: NonEW C[2] JUs do not participate in the EW Network PG and the EW control function.
output: NonEW C[2] JUs do not participate in the EW Network PG and the EW control function.

instruction: What are the functions of C[2] EW JUs?
input: 4.5.1.4 COMMAND AND CONTROL ELECTRONIC WARFARE JTIDS/MIDS UNITS C[2] EW JUs, in addition to the usual C[2] functions, possess organic EW processing capability.
output: C[2] EW JUs, in addition to the usual C[2] functions, possess organic EW processing capability.

instruction: What is the purpose of a C[2] EW JU?
input: A C[2] EW JU has the capacity to collect, coordinate and analyze parametric ES data from the EW Network PG and derive EWS product information for reporting on the Surveillance Network PG. The C[2] EW JU participates in the EW Network PG to control and coordinate EW activities as well as the Surveillance Network PG(s). Additionally, a C[2] EW JU may participate on the Mission Management/Weapons Coordination Network PG(s).
output: The C[2] EW JU is designed to collect, coordinate, and analyze parametric ES data from the EW Network PG and derive EWS product information for reporting on the Surveillance Network PG. It also participates in controlling and coordinating EW activities as well as the Surveillance Network PG(s).

instruction: What networks does a C[2] EW JU participate in?
input: A C[2] EW JU has the capacity to collect, coordinate and analyze parametric ES data from the EW Network PG and derive EWS product information for reporting on the Surveillance Network PG. The C[2] EW JU participates in the EW Network PG to control and coordinate EW activities as well as the Surveillance Network PG(s). Additionally, a C[2] EW JU may participate on the Mission Management/Weapons Coordination Network PG(s).
output: A C[2] EW JU participates in the EW Network PG to control and coordinate EW activities as well as the Surveillance Network PG(s). It may also participate on the Mission Management/Weapons Coordination Network PG(s).

instruction: What is a nonC[2] EW JU?
input: 4.5.1.5 NONCOMMAND AND CONTROL EW JTIDS/MIDS UNITS A nonC[2] EW JU may be either an ES collecting/reporting unit or an EW weapons platform.
output: A nonC[2] EW JU may be either an ES collecting/reporting unit or an EW weapons platform.

instruction: What do NonC[2] EW JUs coordinate with?
input: NonC[2] EW JUs coordinate with C[2] EW JUs and/or with one another.
output: NonC[2] EW JUs coordinate with C[2] EW JUs and/or with one another.

instruction: What will they participate in?
input: They will participate on only the EW Network PG to facilitate the control, coordination, and exchange of EW information.
output: They will participate on only the EW Network PG.

instruction: What does EW control direct?
input: 4.5.2 ELECTRONIC WARFARE COORDINATION PROCEDURES EW control directs actions to be taken by EW Net participants involving radiated electromagnetic energy.
output: Actions to be taken by EW Net participants involving radiated electromagnetic energy.

instruction: What actions are included in the context?
input: Such actions include, among other things, ES, search, direction finding, track evaluation, and jamming.
output: ES, search, direction finding, track evaluation, and jamming.

instruction: What does coordination include in the context of EW?
input: EW ----- ###### coordination includes the sharing of data among the EW net participants to provide the most complete evaluation and fixing of intercepted electronic emissions.
output: Coordination includes the sharing of data among the EW net participants to provide the most complete evaluation and fixing of intercepted electronic emissions.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message?
input: The J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message is used to accomplish both objectives.
output: To accomplish both objectives.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message?
input: 4.5.2.1 ELECTRONIC WARFARE CONTROL INFORMATION EXCHANGE REQUIREMENTS The information exchange requirements are shown in Table 4.5-1 in relation to the Link 16 messages that support them. 4.5.3 ELECTRONIC WARFARE CONTROL/COORDINATION MESSAGE DESCRIPTION Messages used to effect EW control and coordination and to report the results of EW requests are described in the following paragraphs. 4.5.3.1 ELECTRONIC WARFARE CONTROL/COORDINATION MESSAGE The J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message provides the capability to control EW Net participants, to respond to EW Net participants' requests, and to coordinate EW activities among EW Net participants. Any EW Net participant may use the J14.2 message on the EW network.
output: The J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message provides the capability to control EW Net participants, respond to their requests, and coordinate EW activities among participants.

instruction: What are the methods for achieving coordination?
input: Coordination will be achieved by operational plans or by local procedures using voice or other means.
output: Coordination can be achieved through operational plans or by using local procedures via voice or other means.

instruction: What does the J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message contain?
input: The J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message contains the EW Action Value field which is used to specify a requested action and to report the results of this action. The code in the R/C field of the J14.2I word specifies the required responses to the J14.2 message.
output: The J14.2 EW Control/Coordination message contains the EW Action Value field which is used to specify a requested action and to report the results of this action.

instruction: What does the Request Number field in the J14.2 provide?
input: The Request Number field in the J14.2 provides an audit trail to ensure continuity between a request and a response. When the Request Number data element is set to zero in the J14.0 message, it identifies the message as an autonomous report.
output: It provides an audit trail to ensure continuity between a request and a response.

instruction: What does it mean when the Request Number data element is set to zero in the J14.0 message?
input: The Request Number field in the J14.2 provides an audit trail to ensure continuity between a request and a response. When the Request Number data element is set to zero in the J14.0 message, it identifies the message as an autonomous report.
output: It identifies the message as an autonomous report.

instruction: What is the J14.2 message summary section?
input: Refer to the J14.2 Message Summary Section 5.3 for the listing of the J14.2 message words and their respective Data Elements. 4.5.3.2 PARAMETRIC INFORMATION MESSAGE The J14.0 Parametric Information message contains all of the detailed parametric information that may be the result of an ES action.
output: The J14.2 message summary section is Section 5.3.

instruction: What does the text say about J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB reports?
input: ----- ###### The unit originating a J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report always retains reporting responsibility. It is illegal to assume reporting responsibility for another unit's J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report. Each unit initiating a J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report shall assign a TN not currently in use on the interface, even if is believed that such a report may concern the same emitter currently being reported in another J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report by another unit. The exception is a unit originating a J14.0 report on an EW Fix, AOP, or LOB which is currently being reported in a J3.7 message by the same or another unit shall assign the same TN, Reference in the J14.0 message as contained in the J3.7 message.
output: The unit originating a J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report retains reporting responsibility. It is illegal to assume reporting responsibility for another unit's J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report. Each unit initiating a J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report shall assign a TN not currently in use on the interface, even if it is believed that such a report may concern the same emitter currently being reported in another J14.0 EW Fix, AOP, or LOB report by another unit. The exception is a unit originating a J14.0 report on an EW Fix, AOP, or LOB which is currently being reported in a J3.7 message by the same or another unit shall assign the same TN as contained in the J3.7 message.

instruction: What is the Source TN of these J14.0 messages?
input: The Source TN of these J14.0 messages shall be the Source TN of the unit transmitting the J14.0 message.
output: The Source TN of these J14.0 messages shall be the Source TN of the unit transmitting the J14.0 message.

instruction: What does the text say about J14.0 messages transmitted by nonR[2] JUs with Response Indicator set to value 1?
input: J14.0 messages transmitted by nonR[2] JUs with Response Indicator set to value 1 shall not affect reporting responsibility.
output: J14.0 messages transmitted by nonR[2] JUs with Response Indicator set to value 1 shall not affect reporting responsibility.

instruction: What does the J14.0I word contain?
input: The J14.0I word contains the time the parametric information reported on the interface was valid; time is expressed in hours, minutes, and seconds.
output: The J14.0I word contains the time the parametric information reported on the interface was valid

instruction: What does the time in the J14.0I word express?
input: The J14.0I word contains the time the parametric information reported on the interface was valid; time is expressed in hours, minutes, and seconds.
output: The time in the J14.0I word is expressed in hours, minutes, and seconds

instruction: What procedures facilitate conduct of traditional EW functions among the EW capable JUs?
input: These procedures facilitate conduct of traditional EW functions among the EW capable JUs. Procedures specifically designed for EW Control/Coordination are described in the following paragraphs.
output: The text does not provide specific procedures for traditional EW functions among EW capable JUs.

instruction: What is the response required by the R/C procedures specified in paragraph 4.1.7?
input: In each of the following cases the addressee will respond to the requesting J14.2 message with the appropriate J14.2 message as required by the R/C procedures specified in paragraph 4.1.7. However, any J14.0 message transmitted automatically within 5 (5-15, 5) seconds in response to a J14.2 message shall suffice in lieu of a WILCO response.
output: The addressee will respond to the requesting J14.2 message with an appropriate J14.2 message.

instruction: What is a Reference TN?
input: In the following cases when a Reference TN is required, and one is not available, an index number may be used by those JUs incapable of assigning track numbers.
output: A Reference TN is a unique identifier for a track number.

instruction: What is the method to uniquely identify requests and responses?
input: Requests and responses to requests shall be uniquely identified by the combination of Source TN, Addressee TN, and Request Number.
output: Requests and responses are uniquely identified by the combination of Source TN, Addressee TN, and Request Number.

instruction: What associations are reported in J14.2 EWAC=8, 9, 28, and 29 messages?
input: The associations reported in J14.2 EWAC=8, 9, 28, and 29 messages, and disassociation reported in J14.2 EWAC=10, message may be implemented for internal system use only.
output: Associations reported in J14.2 EWAC=8, 9, 28, and 29 messages

instruction: What disassociation is reported in J14.2 EWAC=10 message?
input: The associations reported in J14.2 EWAC=8, 9, 28, and 29 messages, and disassociation reported in J14.2 EWAC=10, message may be implemented for internal system use only.
output: Disassociation reported in J14.2 EWAC=10 message

instruction: What does the text say about the origin of something?
input: They need not be originated by operator action, nor displayed to operators.
output: The text states that it need not be originated by operator action, nor displayed to operators.

instruction: What message type does an EW net participant use to request periodic reports?
input: 4.5.3.3.1 REQUEST PERIODIC REPORT A C[2] EW net participant will transmit a J14.2 message to an EW Net participant under its control to request periodic reports (on an EW intercept previously reported by the addressed EW Net participant) by specifying the track number in Reference TN, setting EW Action Value to value 0, and setting Periodicity of the Report to one of the following values: 1 - Once upon detection.
output: An EW net participant uses a J14.2 message to request periodic reports.

instruction: What information should be included in the J14.2 message?
input: 4.5.3.3.1 REQUEST PERIODIC REPORT A C[2] EW net participant will transmit a J14.2 message to an EW Net participant under its control to request periodic reports (on an EW intercept previously reported by the addressed EW Net participant) by specifying the track number in Reference TN, setting EW Action Value to value 0, and setting Periodicity of the Report to one of the following values: 1 - Once upon detection.
output: The J14.2 message should specify the track number in Reference TN, set EW Action Value to value 0, and set Periodicity of the Report to one of the following values: 1 - Once upon detection.

instruction: What are the intervals at which detection triggers an action?
input: 2 - Upon detection and at 1 minute intervals. ----- ###### 3 - Upon detection and at 5 minute intervals. 4 - Upon detection and at 15 minute intervals. 5 - Upon detection and at hourly intervals. 6 - Upon detection and in accordance with normal transmit rules thereafter.
output: Detection triggers actions at 1, 5, and 15 minute intervals, and hourly intervals.

instruction: What is the response message if the EW net participant does not have R² for the Reference TN?
input: The EW net participant (Addressee TN) will respond with a J14.2 (R/C=7) CANTPRO message if it does not have R² for the Reference TN.
output: The EW net participant will respond with a J14.2 (R/C=7) CANTPRO message.

instruction: What is the response of the system when it receives a J14.2 message?
input: Otherwise, it will respond with periodic reports using the J14.0 message and the same Reference TN and Request Number value as in the requesting J14.2 message.
output: The system responds with periodic reports using the J14.0 message and the same Reference TN and Request Number value as in the requesting J14.2 message.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J3.7 Surveillance message?
input: The C[2] EW Net participant receiving the periodic reports may initiate the J3.7 Surveillance message on the Surveillance Network PG if the data are tactically significant. The C[2] EW Net participant that requested the J14.0 message may cancel the J14.0 message responses by transmitting a J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6. 4.5.3.3.2 REQUEST AUTOMATIC EVALUATION The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 1 requests an evaluation of parameters contained in the accompanying J14.0 message. To provide continuity between the requesting J14.2 message, the J14.0 parametric message and the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message, a Request Number will be provided in each initial word.
output: The J3.7 Surveillance message is initiated by a C[2] EW Net participant receiving periodic reports if the data are tactically significant.

instruction: How can a C[2] EW Net participant cancel a J14.0 message response?
input: The C[2] EW Net participant receiving the periodic reports may initiate the J3.7 Surveillance message on the Surveillance Network PG if the data are tactically significant. The C[2] EW Net participant that requested the J14.0 message may cancel the J14.0 message responses by transmitting a J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6. 4.5.3.3.2 REQUEST AUTOMATIC EVALUATION The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 1 requests an evaluation of parameters contained in the accompanying J14.0 message. To provide continuity between the requesting J14.2 message, the J14.0 parametric message and the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message, a Request Number will be provided in each initial word.
output: A C[2] EW Net participant can cancel a J14.0 message response by transmitting a J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6.

instruction: What does the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 1 request?
input: The C[2] EW Net participant receiving the periodic reports may initiate the J3.7 Surveillance message on the Surveillance Network PG if the data are tactically significant. The C[2] EW Net participant that requested the J14.0 message may cancel the J14.0 message responses by transmitting a J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6. 4.5.3.3.2 REQUEST AUTOMATIC EVALUATION The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 1 requests an evaluation of parameters contained in the accompanying J14.0 message. To provide continuity between the requesting J14.2 message, the J14.0 parametric message and the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message, a Request Number will be provided in each initial word.
output: The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 1 requests an evaluation of parameters contained in the accompanying J14.0 message.

instruction: What parameters are considered in the automatic evaluation?
input: Parameters considered in the automatic evaluation are Agile Emitter, Frequency/Frequency Range, Modulation Code, Pulse Repetition Frequency/Pulse Repetition Interval, Pulse Width, Jitter, Scan Type, Scan Rate, and Polarization.
output: Agile Emitter, Frequency/Frequency Range, Modulation Code, Pulse Repetition Frequency/Pulse Repetition Interval, Pulse Width, Jitter, Scan Type, Scan Rate, and Polarization.

instruction: What data elements may be included in the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message?
input: The responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message may include the following data elements: Emitter Function, Emitter Number, Mode Number, and Emitter Confidence.
output: The responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message may include the following data elements: Emitter Function, Emitter Number, Mode Number, and Emitter Confidence.

instruction: What does the text say about unreported data elements?
input: Unreported data elements will be represented by No Statement.
output: The text states that unreported data elements will be represented by 'No Statement'.

instruction: What does the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 2 request?
input: ----- ###### 4.5.3.3.3 REQUEST MANUAL EVALUATION The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 2 requests an evaluation of an EW LOB, AOP, or Fix designated by Reference TN, and its parameters as included in a previously reported, or if not previously reported, accompanying, J14.0 message.
output: It requests an evaluation of an EW LOB, AOP, or Fix designated by Reference TN, and its parameters as included in a previously reported, or if not previously reported, accompanying J14.0 message.

instruction: What information is included in the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message?
input: Based on information obtained from local sensors, comparison of emitter(s) characteristics to intelligence files, and/or information provided by remote sources, Emitter Number, Emitter Function, Mode Number and/or Emitter Confidence values, if determined, are assigned and reported in the responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message that contains the emitter data.
output: The responding J14.2 (EWAC=7) message includes Emitter Number, Emitter Function, Mode Number, and/or Emitter Confidence values.

instruction: What are the possible values of EWAC?
input: EWAC=1 and 2 may be functionally combined.
output: 1 and 2

instruction: How can EWAC=1 and 2 be combined?
input: EWAC=1 and 2 may be functionally combined.
output: Functionally combined

instruction: What is an example of a single action in the context of design?
input: They may be designed as a single action, e.g., "Request Evaluation", for origination and display.
output: A single action in the context of design may be designed as a single action, e.g., 'Request Evaluation', for origination and display.

instruction: What does EWAC=2 allow the TN to do?
input: All evaluation requests may be transmitted as EWAC=2. Upon receipt of either EWAC=1 or 2, the TN and all parameters for which an evaluation is requested may be made available for operator appreciation, with the receiving operator having the capability to select whether an operator (manual) or computer derived (automatic) evaluation will be made.
output: Upon receipt of either EWAC=1 or 2, the TN and all parameters for which an evaluation is requested may be made available for operator appreciation.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 3?
input: 4.5.3.3.4 REQUEST UPDATE AND WATCH The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 3 requests the addressee to make an initial EW report on the specified Reference TN previously reported by the addressee.
output: It requests the addressee to make an initial EW report on the specified Reference TN previously reported by the addressee.

instruction: What is the purpose of Time Duration in the update reporting?
input: The length of time the requested update reporting is to be performed may be indicated by Time Duration.
output: Time Duration is used to indicate the length of time for the update reporting.

instruction: What is the default Periodicity of Report value?
input: If Periodicity of Report is set to value 0 (No Statement), a single report shall be made, and then the addressee shall watch the intercept and report only tactically significant changes.
output: The default Periodicity of Report value is 0 (No Statement).

instruction: What action should be taken after making a single report with Periodicity of Report set to 0?
input: If Periodicity of Report is set to value 0 (No Statement), a single report shall be made, and then the addressee shall watch the intercept and report only tactically significant changes.
output: After making a single report with Periodicity of Report set to 0, the addressee shall watch the intercept and report only tactically significant changes.

instruction: What must be set for Time Duration?
input: In this case Time Duration must be set to No Statement.
output: Time Duration must be set to No Statement.

instruction: What is the definition of tactical significance?
input: Determination of tactical significance shall be an operator function, i.e., after the initial report subsequent updates must be operator initiated.
output: The determination of tactical significance is an operator function that requires subsequent updates to be initiated by the operator.

instruction: What message should the addressee respond with if it does not have R² for the Reference TN?
input: The addressee shall respond with a J14.2 (R/C=7) CANTPRO message if it does not have R² for the Reference TN.
output: J14.2 (R/C=7) CANTPRO message

instruction: What is EWAC=3?
input: EWAC=3 is a special case of EWAC=0, i.e., it reports at a periodicity of once now and only upon changes considered tactically significant by an operator thereafter. Systems may be designed such that EWAC=0 and 3 are functionally combined.
output: EWAC=3 is a special case of EWAC=0, reporting at a periodicity of once now and only upon changes considered tactically significant by an operator thereafter.

instruction: What is an example of a single action designed for origination and display?

instruction: What does the text say about J14.2 messages?

instruction: What value should be set for the Receipt/Compliance field for a sector or bearing search addressed to an individual JU?

instruction: What is the purpose of a J14.2 message with R/C set to value 0?
input: If a J14.2 with R/C set to value 0 directs a search against known threats which are not implemented by the addressee, and no other implemented parameters are designated, the addressee shall transmit a J14.2 CANTPRO (R/C = 7) message with EW Action Value set to value 4. Upon completion of the search with no results, the addressee will transmit a J14.2 message to the requesting unit containing the same Request Number and Reference TN values as were received, the EW Action Value set to value 11, and the Reference EW Action Value set to value 4. If information is available after the search, the addressee will transmit a J14.2 message to the requesting unit containing the same Request Number value received in the requesting J14.2 message. The data acquired during the search by the addressee will be transmitted to the requesting unit in a J14.0 message with the same Request Number value as was received.
output: A J14.2 message with R/C set to value 0 directs a search against known threats which are not implemented by the addressee.

instruction: What is the purpose of a J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6?
input: ----- ###### 4.5.3.3.6 CANCEL REQUEST A C[2] EW Net participant may cancel a previous request by initiating the transmission of another J14.2 message to the same addressee indicating the request number to be cancelled and EW Action Value set to value 5, and Reference EW Action Value set to the EW Action Value of the previous request. 4.5.3.3.7 CEASE REPORT The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 6 directs the addressee to cease reporting on an EW LOB, AOP, or Fix specified in Reference TN.
output: To direct the addressee to cease reporting on an EW LOB, AOP, or Fix specified in Reference TN.

instruction: What should be set to the EW Action Value if the reports were in response to a previous request?

instruction: What does Time Duration being set to a value other than No Statement mean?
input: If Time Duration is set to a value other than No Statement, the reporting shall only be interrupted for the specified length of time, beginning either immediately after the reception of the J14.2 (Immediate Action Indicator set to value 1) or at a specified time.
output: It means that the reporting will only be interrupted for the specified length of time, either immediately after the reception of the J14.2 (Immediate Action Indicator set to value 1) or at a specified time.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 7?

instruction: What does the Electronic Warfare Coordinator Indicator (EWC IND) determine if set to value 1?

instruction: What is the purpose of the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 8?

instruction: What does the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 9 report?

instruction: What is the purpose of the EVALUATE TRACK A J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 13?
input: 4.5.3.3.14 EVALUATE TRACK A J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 13 directs the addressee to evaluate the sector specified in Sector Width, which is centered on the bearing between the receiving JU and the Reference TN, and whose origin is the receiving JU, and to report EA intercepts for the duration of the time specified in Time Duration.

instruction: What is a search for specific jammers directed by?

instruction: What does the text say about how a unit handles multiple track evaluation requests?
input: A unit may service multiple track evaluation requests. However, if a servicing unit is limited in capability to one request at a time per requesting unit, and a second ----- ###### track evaluation request is received from the same requesting unit, the servicing unit shall only service that unit's latest request. If the latest request causes the total number of evaluations that the unit can service simultaneously to be exceeded, the oldest request is cancelled and the new request is serviced.
output: A unit can service multiple track evaluation requests. However, if a servicing unit is limited in capability to one request at a time per requesting unit, and a second request is received from the same requesting unit, the servicing unit will only service that unit's latest request. If the latest request causes the total number of evaluations that the unit can service simultaneously to be exceeded, the oldest request is cancelled and the new request is serviced.

instruction: What is the purpose of a message with EW Action Value set to value 14?
input: 4.5.3.3.15 EVALUATE SECTOR A J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 14 directs the addressee to evaluate the sector specified in Sector Width, which is centered on the bearing specified in the Bearing field, and whose origin is the receiving JU, and to report EA intercepts for the duration of the time specified in Time Duration.
output: The purpose is to direct the addressee to evaluate a specified sector and report EA intercepts for a given duration.

instruction: What does "Time Duration" mean in the context of a report?
input: If Time Duration is No Statement, a one-time report is requested.
output: It refers to the amount of time taken to complete a task or process.

instruction: What does a 360° search request mean if Sector Width is No Statement?

instruction: What does the text say about servicing sector evaluation requests?
input: A unit may service multiple sector evaluation requests. However, if a servicing unit is limited in capability to one request at a time per requesting unit, and a second sector evaluation request is received from the same requesting unit, the servicing unit shall only service that unit's latest request. If the latest request causes the total number of evaluations that the unit can service simultaneously to be exceeded, the oldest request shall be cancelled and the new request shall be serviced.
output: A unit can service multiple sector evaluation requests, but if it is limited to one request at a time per requesting unit, the latest request from the same unit will be serviced. instruction: What does the J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 16 request?
input: 4.5.3.3.17 PROTECT REQUEST The J14.2 message with EW Action Value set to value 16 and a frequency/ frequency range specified by the J14.2C4 word requests that a friendly frequency/frequency range used for a particular operation shall be protected in order to prevent it from being inadvertently jammed by friendly forces while active EW operations are directed against hostile forces. The time and time duration of this frequency protection may be specified by Hour, Minute, and Time Duration of the J14.2E0 word; if no time and no time duration are specified, the frequency/frequency range protection shall last from the time of reception of the J14.2 message until either an appropriate cancel request is received or until a new protection for this frequency/frequency range is ordered.

output: J14.2 messages containing this EW Action Value may be transmitted on both the EW NPG and the Weapons Coordination and Management NPG.

instruction: What happens when a JU stops reporting EW information on the EW NPG?
input: J14.2 messages containing this EW Action Value may be transmitted on both the EW NPG and the Weapons Coordination and Management NPG. 4.5.4 TERMINATION OF ELECTRONIC WARFARE PARAMETRIC DATA When a JU stops reporting EW information that it has been reporting on the EW NPG, it may transmit a J7.0 (ACT = 0) message on the EW NPG.
output: When a JU stops reporting EW information that it has been reporting on the EW NPG, it may transmit a J7.0 (ACT = 0) message on the EW NPG.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J6.0 Amplification message?
input: ----- ###### MIL-STD-6016B THIS PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK ----- ###### 4.6 AMPLIFICATION Amplification information is exchanged in the J6.0 Amplification message. The J6.0 Amplification message is used to report information gained by collection techniques; i.e., other than those normally associated with data link information reporting (radar and sonar contacts and EW detections), about surveillance tracks or points that are being reported in other messages.
output: The J6.0 Amplification message is used to report information gained by collection techniques about surveillance tracks or points that are being reported in other messages.

instruction: What is the purpose of the message?
input: Any unit may use this message to provide amplifying information on an existing track or point.
output: The message can be used to provide amplifying information on an existing track or point.

instruction: What is the amplifying information transmitted by the JU?
input: This amplifying information is transmitted by the JU deriving the information and is independent of track reporting and R[2].
output: The amplifying information is transmitted by the JU deriving the information and is independent of track reporting and R[2].

instruction: What does the SPI field in the J6.0I Amplification initial word indicate?
input: The SPI field in the J6.0I Amplification initial word indicates whether the information contained in the J6.0 message requires special processing.
output: The SPI field indicates whether the information contained in the J6.0 message requires special processing.

instruction: What is the purpose of the SPI field?
input: The SPI field for this information is independent of the basic track message. Additionally, the SPI field value must be maintained when information received requires special processing and that information is retransmitted, unless all of the retransmitted information is derived by local means and does not require special processing or a determination has been made that special processing is no longer required.
output: The SPI field is used to maintain the message integrity and ensure that the message is not altered during transmission.

instruction: What is R[2] used for in the J6.0 Amplification message?
input: R[2], as defined for track messages, is not used for information reported in the J6.0 Amplification message.
output: R[2], as defined for track messages, is not used for information reported in the J6.0 Amplification message.

instruction: What information may JU report?
input: Any JU having information may report the most current local information and may report the latest data link information received for which no locally derived information is available.
output: Any JU having information may report the most current local information and may report the latest data link information received for which no locally derived information is available.

instruction: What are the procedures for reporting amplification information?
input: The procedures for reporting amplification information are described below.
output: The procedures for reporting amplification information are described below.

instruction: What is the TN of the track or point being amplified contained in?
input: 4.6.1 AMPLIFICATION INFORMATION The TN of the track or point which is being amplified is contained in the J6.0I word. The specific type and activity amplification index of that TN are reported in the J6.0E0 word.
output: The TN of the track or point being amplified is contained in the J6.0I word.

instruction: What is the purpose of reporting the current activity of the track or point?
input: When reporting the current activity of the track or point, the latest available information is reported redundantly in accordance with the message transmission rules.
output: To provide the latest available information redundantly according to message transmission rules.

instruction: What does a change in the current activity do to redundant transmissions?
input: A change in the current activity shall interrupt the redundant transmissions.
output: It interrupts them.

instruction: What does the J6.0 message report?
input: The capability exists in the J6.0 message to report pairings or engagements between any two TNs regardless of their environment/category. Even though this capability exists, it shall not be used to report pairings or engagements which are ----- ###### specified for reporting in the J10.6 Pairing message and the J10.2 Engagement Status message. Systems shall not allow the J6.0 messages that report pairings or engagements to overlay or replace pairings or engagements established by the J10.6 and J10.2 messages.
output: Pairings or engagements between any two TNs regardless of their environment/category.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J6.0 message?
input: The capability exists in the J6.0 message to report pairings or engagements between any two TNs regardless of their environment/category. Even though this capability exists, it shall not be used to report pairings or engagements which are ----- ###### specified for reporting in the J10.6 Pairing message and the J10.2 Engagement Status message. Systems shall not allow the J6.0 messages that report pairings or engagements to overlay or replace pairings or engagements established by the J10.6 and J10.2 messages.
output: To report pairings or engagements established by the J10.6 and J10.2 messages.

instruction: What should not be used to report pairings or engagements?
input: The capability exists in the J6.0 message to report pairings or engagements between any two TNs regardless of their environment/category. Even though this capability exists, it shall not be used to report pairings or engagements which are ----- ###### specified for reporting in the J10.6 Pairing message and the J10.2 Engagement Status message. Systems shall not allow the J6.0 messages that report pairings or engagements to overlay or replace pairings or engagements established by the J10.6 and J10.2 messages.
output: J6.0 messages that report pairings or engagements specified for reporting in the J10.6 Pairing message and the J10.2 Engagement Status message.

instruction: What must be implemented for display of both types of pairings or engagements?
input: When the display of both types of pairings or engagements is implemented, they must be unique so as to avoid operator misinterpretation.
output: They must be unique to avoid operator misinterpretation.

instruction: What is the purpose of the RESET value in 4.6.2?
input: 4.6.2 RESET The Reset To No Statement value is transmitted only as a result of operator action.
output: The RESET value is transmitted only as a result of operator action.

instruction: What can operators change a reported nonzero value to?
input: It is provided to permit operators to change a reported nonzero value, in applicable fields except the TN field, to No Statement when the reported nonzero value is determined to no longer be valid because of erroneous entry; aging of data to such an extent that it is no longer tactically significant; the reporting process is no longer occurring; etc., and no other nonzero value for that particular field is appropriate for transmission.
output: No Statement

instruction: In which fields can this change be made?
input: It is provided to permit operators to change a reported nonzero value, in applicable fields except the TN field, to No Statement when the reported nonzero value is determined to no longer be valid because of erroneous entry; aging of data to such an extent that it is no longer tactically significant; the reporting process is no longer occurring; etc., and no other nonzero value for that particular field is appropriate for transmission.
output: All fields except TN

instruction: Why might operators change a reported nonzero value?
input: It is provided to permit operators to change a reported nonzero value, in applicable fields except the TN field, to No Statement when the reported nonzero value is determined to no longer be valid because of erroneous entry; aging of data to such an extent that it is no longer tactically significant; the reporting process is no longer occurring; etc., and no other nonzero value for that particular field is appropriate for transmission.
output: Erroneous entry, data aging, or the reporting process no longer occurring

instruction: What is the purpose of the Reset To No Statement value?
input: When a system can no longer support the continued reporting of the J6.0 message data due to reasons not associated with the degree of validity of the data, such as dropping the tracks due to display considerations, technical limitations as to number of tracks on which such data can be reported, etc., the Reset To No Statement value shall not be transmitted.
output: The Reset To No Statement value is used when a system can no longer support the continued reporting of the J6.0 message data due to reasons not associated with the degree of validity of the data, such as dropping the tracks due to display considerations, technical limitations as to number of tracks on which such data can be reported, etc.

instruction: What does the text say about the transmission of J6.0 messages?
input: 4.6.3 FILTERING OF AMPLIFICATION DATA Systems implementing the transmission of the J6.0 message should have the capability to filter these messages based upon the setting of the SPI field. If the SPI field is set in the J6.0I word and a security filter exists on a specific link, the J6.0 message shall not be sent on that link even if a track alert exists on the associated track data. If it is determined that the J6.0 message data are to be transmitted or forwarded on a link that has a security filter, the SPI field must be set to zero or the security filter must be removed. The determination to transmit or forward the J6.0 message data will be controlled by the interface operating procedures.
output: The text explains that systems implementing the transmission of the J6.0 message should have the capability to filter these messages based on the setting of the SPI field. If the SPI field is set in the J6.0I word and a security filter exists on a specific link, the J6.0 message shall not be sent on that link even if a track alert exists on the associated track data. If it is determined that the J6.0 message data are to be transmitted or forwarded on a link that has a security filter, the SPI field must be set to zero or the security filter must be removed.

instruction: What is the termination condition for Amplification data transmission?
input: ----- ###### 4.6.4 TERMINATION OF AMPLIFICATION DATA The transmission of Amplification data shall be terminated when the track or point being amplified is no longer being reported on the interface.
output: Amplification data transmission shall be terminated when the track or point being amplified is no longer being reported on the interface.

instruction: What is the information purged for?
input: The information may be purged in accordance with system design.
output: In accordance with system design.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J6.0 message retransmission?
input: 4.6.5 RESPONSE INDICATOR When the J6.0 message is being retransmitted as a result of a J7.1 Data Update Request message, the Response Indicator field shall be set to 1.
output: The J6.0 message is retransmitted as a result of a J7.1 Data Update Request message.

instruction: What is the primary purpose of certain J6.0 data fields?

instruction: What is the Objective TN?

output: The Objective TN is a track or point that is being targeted by the Reference TN.

instruction: What does the TN of the Controlling Agency represent?

instruction: What are the first ten values of AAI for each E/C report actions normally associated with engagement?
input: Note that the first ten values (1-10) of AAI for each E/C report actions normally associated with engagement. Furthermore, the first ten values of Air and Land AAI are specifically designed to represent a normal engagement sequence.

instruction: What is the purpose of the LOCAL DISCRETE IDENTIFIER (LDI) field?
input: 4.6.6.3 LOCAL DISCRETE IDENTIFIER (LDI) The LDI field is used to report a number between 1 and 4094, the meaning of which has been promulgated separately by Operation Order or other means.
output: The LDI field is used to report a number between 1 and 4094, the meaning of which has been promulgated separately by Operation Order or other means.

instruction: What does the LDI field provide?

instruction: What is the purpose of the mentioned tool?
input: It may be used for any such purpose deemed necessary by the operational commander, although its use will normally be confined to supporting the amplification reporting function.
output: It may be used for any such purpose deemed necessary by the operational commander, although its use will normally be confined to supporting the amplification reporting function.

instruction: What is the relationship between the J6.0 and J14.0 LDI fields?
input: The J6.0 and J14.0 LDI fields are independent of each other, i.e. ; the operational commander may promulgate two separate LDI lists, one to support amplification reporting and another to support EW reporting, or the operational commander may specify identical LDI lists for the J6.0 and J14.0. If the Reference TN is being reported in both a J6.0 and J14.0 message, the LDI field reported in each need not be the same. Also, the J6.0 and J14.0 LDI fields are independent of the J7.5 Special Code I, II, III fields.
output: The J6.0 and J14.0 LDI fields are independent of each other, meaning the operational commander can create separate LDI lists for amplification and EW reporting, or use identical lists for both fields.

instruction: What are the Special Code fields used for?
input: The Special Code fields are used for a similar purpose as the LDI fields, but are normally for general use rather than supporting amplification or EW reporting.
output: The Special Code fields are used for general purposes, similar to LDI fields, but not specifically for amplification or EW reporting.

instruction: What does the text say about operational commanders?
input: However, an operational commander may specify identical Special Code and LDI lists.
output: The text states that an operational commander may specify identical Special Code and LDI lists.

output: J6.0 information should be independent of data reported in other messages, except for the TNs.

instruction: What should be done if the unit originating amplification information also has R[2] for the reference TN?
input: However, differences between the locally held Surveillance E/C and the locally derived E/C shall be resolved before originating or updating ----- ###### amplification information. If the unit originating amplification information also has R[2] for the reference TN, the reported Surveillance E/C and the E/C reported in the J6.0 message must be the same. If the unit does not hold R[2] for the Reference TN, it shall either change the E/C reported in the J6.0 message to that reported by the R[2] unit, or transmit a J7.0 (ACT = 1) E/C Difference Report, and shall not transmit the J6.0 Amplification message until a track report is received with the same E/C as the locally derived E/C reported in the J6.0 message. If the received J6.0 E/C does not match the E/C of the held TN, the J6.0 message shall be discarded.
output: The reported Surveillance E/C and the E/C reported in the J6.0 message must be the same.

instruction: What is the purpose of processing amplification data upon receipt?

instruction: What is the behavior of systems when receiving remote J6.0 data from multiple sources about the same track?

output: Systems may choose to store and display the data from any or all of these sources, and select the data to be retained either automatically or manually.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.0 (ACT = 0) Drop Track Report message?
input: 4.7.1.1 DROP TRACK REPORT The J7.0 (ACT = 0) Drop Track Report message is transmitted by the JU with R[2] to indicate that the JU with R[2] specified in the Source TN field has dropped or has ceased reporting the track specified in the Reference TN field. A J7.0 (ACT = 0) message shall not be sent when a track is no longer being reported due to a shift in R[2].
output: The J7.0 (ACT = 0) Drop Track Report message is used by the JU with R[2] to indicate that it has dropped or ceased reporting a track specified in the Reference TN field.

instruction: What is the condition under which a J7.0 (ACT = 0) message should not be sent?
input: 4.7.1.1 DROP TRACK REPORT The J7.0 (ACT = 0) Drop Track Report message is transmitted by the JU with R[2] to indicate that the JU with R[2] specified in the Source TN field has dropped or has ceased reporting the track specified in the Reference TN field. A J7.0 (ACT = 0) message shall not be sent when a track is no longer being reported due to a shift in R[2].
output: A J7.0 (ACT = 0) message should not be sent when a track is no longer being reported due to a shift in R[2].

instruction: What does the IDENTITY (ID) AND ENVIRONMENT/CATEGORY (E/C) DIFFERENCE REPORT address?
input: 4.7.1.2 IDENTITY (ID) AND ENVIRONMENT/CATEGORY (E/C) DIFFERENCE REPORT The exchange of Surveillance data requires procedures to recognize and resolve differences in ID and Environment/Category.
output: The IDENTITY (ID) AND ENVIRONMENT/CATEGORY (E/C) DIFFERENCE REPORT addresses the exchange of Surveillance data and the procedures to recognize and resolve differences in ID and Environment/Category.

instruction: What does the J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report message indicate?
input: The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report message indicates that the JU specified in the Source TN field has local Environment/Category, ID, Identity Amplifying Descriptor, or Exercise Indicator data information different from that currently being reported on the track specified in the Reference TN field. The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report may also indicate that the transmitting JU has different data in the Platform and/or Platform Activity fields; however, differences in these fields shall be included only when differences in the Environment/Category, Identity, Exercise Indicator, or Special Interest Indicator are also being reported for the specified track.
output: The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report message indicates that the JU specified in the Source TN field has local Environment/Category, ID, Identity Amplifying Descriptor, or Exercise Indicator data information different from that currently being reported on the track specified in the Reference TN field.

instruction: What else can the J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report indicate?
input: The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report message indicates that the JU specified in the Source TN field has local Environment/Category, ID, Identity Amplifying Descriptor, or Exercise Indicator data information different from that currently being reported on the track specified in the Reference TN field. The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report may also indicate that the transmitting JU has different data in the Platform and/or Platform Activity fields; however, differences in these fields shall be included only when differences in the Environment/Category, Identity, Exercise Indicator, or Special Interest Indicator are also being reported for the specified track.
output: The J7.0 (ACT = 1) Difference Report may also indicate that the transmitting JU has different data in the Platform and/or Platform Activity fields; however, differences in these fields shall be included only when differences in the Environment/Category, Identity, Exercise Indicator, or Special Interest Indicator are also being reported for the specified track.

instruction: What is the rule for resolving conflicts when a JU receives a Surveillance message or a J7.0 (ACT = 1) message with conflicting Environment/Category and ID?
input: When a JU receives a Surveillance message or a J7.0 (ACT = 1) message in which the air, surface (maritime), or land (ground) Environment/Category and ID are different from the local Environment/Category and ID, the Environment/Category conflict shall be processed and resolved prior to the resolution of the ID conflict. That is, if an Environment/Category conflict is detected, no further processing to detect an ID conflict need occur.
output: When a JU receives such messages, the Environment/Category conflict must be resolved before attempting to resolve the ID conflict.

instruction: What is the significance of Exercise Indicator conflicts?
input: When a JU receives a Surveillance message in which the Exercise Indicator is different from local Exercise Indicator data or a J7.0 (ACT = 1) message in which the Exercise Indicator is different from the local Exercise Indicator, ----- ###### a conflict exists and the operator shall be alerted for manual resolution. Exercise Indicator conflicts will be resolved prior to ID or Identity Amplifying Descriptor Conflict resolution. instruction: What should the system do if directed to automatically accept the remote ID?

instruction: What happens if the R[2] JU is directed to automatically accept the remote ID?

JUs shall not transmit a J7.0 (ACT = 2) message containing an ID of Pending. d. Units receiving a J7.0 (ACT = 2) Change Data Order message containing an ID of Pending shall not accept that order.

instruction: What is the purpose of J7.0 messages in relation to alerts?
input: All receiving JUs shall clear the alert in their databases upon receipt of the J7.0 (ACT = 3 or 4). Optionally, alerts may be cleared by reception of a J2.0 message with the EMG IND and/or FT IND set to value 0. A JU shall initiate/terminate an alert on a PU/RU being forwarded onto Link 16 by setting/clearing the alert indicator with a J7.0 (ACT = 3 or 4) message.
output: J7.0 messages are used to clear alerts in the databases of receiving JUs upon receipt of an ACT value of 3 or 4. They can also clear alerts by receiving a J2.0 message with EMG IND and/or FT IND set to value 0.

instruction: What does the JU with R[2] do when initiating a force tell alert?
input: Optionally, alerts may be cleared by reception of a J3.0 message with the FT IND set to value 0. The JU with R[2] shall initiate a force tell alert on a segmented line or multisided area by transmitting the FT IND set to value 1 in all J3.0 messages used to report the line or area. The JU with R[2] shall terminate a force tell alert by transmitting a J7.0 (ACT = 4) message terminating the alert for each Reference TN which has been used to report the line or area and setting the FT IND to value 0 in subsequent J3.0 messages. A JU without R[2] shall initiate/terminate a force tell alert on a segmented line or multisided area by setting/clearing the FT IND in a J7.0 (ACT = 4) message for each Reference TN which has been used to report the line or area. Upon receipt, the JU with R[2] shall set/clear the FT IND in all J3.0 messages used to report the line or area. All receiving JUs shall set the FT IND to value 1 in their database for all TNs in a segmented line or multisided area if a J3.0 message with the FT IND field set to value 1 or a J7.0 (ACT = 4) message with the Alert Status Change ----- ###### field set to value 1 is received for any TN in the line or area. All receiving JUs shall terminate the force tell alert on all TNs in a segmented line or multisided area on receipt of a J7.0 (ACT = 4) message clearing the force tell on any TN in the line or area. A JU initiating a force tell alert on a slaved reference point or area shall also initiate an alert on the Related TN, as specified above, if Related TN does not already have the FT IND set. When the alert is terminated for the reference point or area, the JU terminating the alert shall also terminate the alert for Related TN, unless Related TN had the FT IND set prior to the slaved point or area alert being initiated. A JU terminating a force tell alert on a track shall also terminate the force tell alert on any reference point or area that is slaved to the track.
output: The JU with R[2] initiates a force tell alert on a segmented line or multisided area by transmitting the FT IND set to value 1 in all J3.0 messages used to report the line or area.

instruction: What is the purpose of emergency alerts?
input: Emergency alerts are not used on reference points, lines, or areas. 4.7.1.4.4 ALERT INDICATORS FOR EMERGENCY POINTS Alerts are not used for the J3.1 Emergency Point message since these points cannot be filtered. 4.7.1.4.5 ALERT INDICATORS FOR TRACKS A JU with R[2] shall initiate an emergency or force tell alert on tracks by setting the appropriate EMG IND or FT IND in the J3.2 Air Track, J3.3 Surface (Maritime) Track, J3.4 Subsurface (Maritime) Track, or J3.5 Land (Ground) Point/Track message.
output: Emergency alerts are used to notify users of potential threats or emergencies.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.0 (ACT = 5) Strength Change message?

The J7.0 (ACT = 5) message is initiated as a result of operator action by a JU without R[2] to indicate a known Strength or Vehicle Strength change. All JUs that implement the J3.5C3 word shall accept Vehicle Strength changes when received or indicate to the operator that a Vehicle Strength change has been received. All JUs shall accept Strength changes when received or indicate to the operator that a Strength change has been received.

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.1 message?

output: The J7.1 message is used to request data updates.

instruction: What is the purpose of setting the Action, Data Update Request field to value 1?
input: Data on a specific TN by setting the Action, Data Update Request field to value 1, b. Data by specific request indicator values by setting the Action, Data Update Request field to value 0, or c. Space track state vector or covariance data by setting the Action, Data Update Request field to value 2.
output: To request data on a specific TN

Space track state vector or covariance data by setting the Action, Data Update Request field to value 2.
output: To request space track state vector or covariance data

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.1 (ACT = 1) Data Update Request by TN message?
input: 4.7.2.1 DATA UPDATE REQUEST BY TRACK NUMBER The J7.1 (ACT = 1) Data Update Request by TN or (ACT = 2) Ballistic Missile Update Request message has the capability to request update information on a specific TN. When used for this purpose, the requesting JU initiates the J7.1 (ACT = 1 or 2) message with the specific TN in the Reference TN field and addressed to a specific Addressee TN(s) or to the collective address of 00177 octal. The responding JU(s), whether a specific address or collective addressee, shall then reply as described below.
output: The J7.1 (ACT = 1) Data Update Request by TN message is used to request update information on a specific Track Number (TN).

instruction: How should the requesting JU address the J7.1 (ACT = 2) Ballistic Missile Update Request message?
input: 4.7.2.1 DATA UPDATE REQUEST BY TRACK NUMBER The J7.1 (ACT = 1) Data Update Request by TN or (ACT = 2) Ballistic Missile Update Request message has the capability to request update information on a specific TN. When used for this purpose, the requesting JU initiates the J7.1 (ACT = 1 or 2) message with the specific TN in the Reference TN field and addressed to a specific Addressee TN(s) or to the collective address of 00177 octal. The responding JU(s), whether a specific address or collective addressee, shall then reply as described below.
output: The requesting JU should address the J7.1 (ACT = 2) Ballistic Missile Update Request message to a specific Addressee TN(s) or to the collective address of 00177 octal.

instruction: What does the JU with reporting responsibility need to respond with upon receiving a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN?
input: 4.7.2.1.1 SURVEILLANCE DATA FROM A JU WITH REPORTING RESPONSIBILITY IN RESPONSE TO A DATA UPDATE REQUEST The JU with R[2] shall respond with surveillance information upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN.
output: The JU with reporting responsibility needs to respond with surveillance information.

instruction: What data will be transmitted by the JU?
input: This JU shall transmit all data ----- ###### held in the appropriate J3 message, except that covariance data will not be included on ballistic missile tracks.
output: All data except covariance data on ballistic missile tracks.

instruction: What does a JU with R[2] for a line or area transmit upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1)?
input: A JU with R[2] for a line or area shall transmit the entire line or area upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) for any TN used to define the line or area.
output: It transmits the entire line or area.

instruction: What is the purpose of the JU(s) that have originated surveillance amplification data on the track?
input: 4.7.2.1.2 SURVEILLANCE AMPLIFICATION DATA FROM A JU IN RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS Upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN, the JU(s) that have originated surveillance amplification data on the track shall respond with the J6.0 Amplification message containing all available data. 4.7.2.1.3 CONTROLLING UNIT RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS Upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN, the JU controlling the TN shall transmit the appropriate J10 Weapons Coordination and Management messages and J13 Platform and System Status messages to include the J10.5 Controlling Unit Report message, the J10.2 Engagement Status message, and the appropriate J13 Platform and System Status messages. 4.7.2.1.4 C[2] JU RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS FOR OWN TN All C[2] JUs receiving a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message containing their own TN shall transmit J10.2 Engagement Status messages to report the status of all engagements they are conducting and a J13 Platform and System Status message to report their own status. 4.7.2.1.5 ELECTRONIC WARFARE DATA IN RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS If the Reference TN is being reported in a J3.7 message, the reporting JU shall transmit all data held in a J3.7 message. Also, if the request is collectively addressed, any JU which has initiated an EW evaluation or association on the Reference TN in a J14.2 message shall transmit a J14.2 message with EW Action Value field set to values 7, 8, or 9 addressed to the requesting unit with the R/C field set to value 1. If the request is specifically addressed, the addressee shall transmit all locally held EW evaluations and associations in the J14.2 message with EW Action Value field ----- ###### set to values 7, 8, or 9 addressed to the requesting unit with R/C field set to value 1.
output: Upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN, the JU(s) that have originated surveillance amplification data on the track shall respond with the J6.0 Amplification message containing all available data.

instruction: What does the JU controlling the TN do upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN?
input: 4.7.2.1.2 SURVEILLANCE AMPLIFICATION DATA FROM A JU IN RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS Upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN, the JU(s) that have originated surveillance amplification data on the track shall respond with the J6.0 Amplification message containing all available data. 4.7.2.1.3 CONTROLLING UNIT RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS Upon receipt of a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message on a specific TN, the JU controlling the TN shall transmit the appropriate J10 Weapons Coordination and Management messages and J13 Platform and System Status messages to include the J10.5 Controlling Unit Report message, the J10.2 Engagement Status message, and the appropriate J13 Platform and System Status messages. 4.7.2.1.4 C[2] JU RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS FOR OWN TN All C[2] JUs receiving a J7.1 (ACT = 1) message containing their own TN shall transmit J10.2 Engagement Status messages to report the status of all engagements they are conducting and a J13 Platform and System Status message to report their own status. 4.7.2.1.5 ELECTRONIC WARFARE DATA IN RESPONSE TO DATA UPDATE REQUESTS If the Reference TN is being reported in a J3.7 message, the reporting JU shall transmit all data held in a J3.7 message. Also, if the request is collectively addressed, any JU which has initiated an EW evaluation or association on the Reference TN in a J14.2 message shall transmit a J14.2 message with EW Action Value field set to values 7, 8, or 9 addressed to the requesting unit with the R/C field set to value 1. instruction: What is required for recognition and resolution of dual designations?
input: The recognition and resolution of dual designations require all IUs to periodically compare remote tracks to local tracks (and, optionally, to common local tracks) to determine if a dual designation has occurred.
output: It requires all IUs to periodically compare remote tracks to local tracks (and, optionally, to common local tracks) to determine if a dual designation has occurred.

instruction: What action should a C[2] JU take when recognizing two eligible tracks for correlation?
input: When a C[2] JU recognizes that two tracks which are being reported to the interface are eligible for correlation, that JU shall initiate action, either automatically or manually, to resolve the dual designation. The recognizing JU shall transmit the J7.2 Correlation message requesting all other C[2] IUs to perform a correlation of the two tracks.
output: The C[2] JU should initiate action, either automatically or manually, to resolve the dual designation.

instruction: What is the purpose of the message?
input: The message identifies the TN to be retained and the TN to be dropped.
output: The message identifies the TN to be retained and the TN to be dropped.

instruction: What conditions can cause the receiving IU to reject the requested correlation or respond with a reverse correlation request?
input: The receiving IUs shall accept the requested correlation unless certain prespecified conditions exist which require or allow the receiving IU to reject the requested correlation or respond with a reverse correlation request.
output: Certain prespecified conditions that exist.

instruction: What does the J7.2 message indicate about constraints?
input: The originating JU indicates in the J7.2 message if it has any constraint which would prohibit accepting a reverse correlation.
output: The J7.2 message indicates if the originating JU has any constraint that would prohibit accepting a reverse correlation.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Response Value (RV) field?
input: The Response Value (RV) field is provided for this purpose.
output: To provide a response value for a given input or query.

instruction: What does a value of 0 in the RV field indicate?
input: When the RV field is set to value 0 it indicates a reverse correlation would be acceptable, and when the RV field is set to value 1 it indicates a reverse correlation request would be rejected. Receiving IUs desiring to reverse the requested correlation use the RV field to determine if a reverse correlation request should be originated or if the original correlation request should be rejected. Whenever a correlation request is rejected the J7.2 message with the RV field set to value 2 shall be transmitted to report the rejection. When the RV field is set to value 3, it indicates the correlation was manually initiated and shall be accepted unless certain conditions apply which require rejection (see paragraph 4.7.3.2.c).
output: A value of 0 in the RV field indicates a reverse correlation would be acceptable.

instruction: What does a value of 1 in the RV field indicate?
input: When the RV field is set to value 0 it indicates a reverse correlation would be acceptable, and when the RV field is set to value 1 it indicates a reverse correlation request would be rejected. Receiving IUs desiring to reverse the requested correlation use the RV field to determine if a reverse correlation request should be originated or if the original correlation request should be rejected. Whenever a correlation request is rejected the J7.2 message with the RV field set to value 2 shall be transmitted to report the rejection. output: A value of 1 in the RV field indicates a reverse correlation request would be rejected.

instruction: What message is transmitted when a TN pair is determined to be a dual designation?
input: Whenever a TN pair is determined, to be a dual designation, the recognizing JU shall initiate transmission of the J7.2 message with the Retained TN/Dropped TN selection in accordance with paragraph 4.4.4.3.1j.

instruction: What happens if a selection conflict occurs due to OCCs on both the Retained TN and the Dropped TN?
input: If a selection conflict occurs due to OCCs on both the Retained TN and the Dropped TN the correlation shall be abandoned until the next correlation check.
output: The correlation shall be abandoned until the next correlation check.

instruction: What action should a C[2] JU take if it holds R[2] for the Dropped TN?

The J7.0 (ACT = 0) message shall be transmitted after the J7.2 message. d. C[2] JUs capable of transmitting the J7.2 message shall have an operator selectable capability to deactivate automatic transmission of the message.

The J7.0 (ACT = 0) message shall be transmitted after the J7.2 message. d. C[2] JUs capable of transmitting the J7.2 message shall have an operator selectable capability to deactivate automatic transmission of the message.

instruction: What is the condition for a JU to automatically report new data in a J7.5 message?
input: Any JU without R[2] entering a change of nonzero to nonzero or zero to nonzero value to its locally held Mode I, III or IV IFF/SIF data, or a change from zero to nonzero Mode II data, shall automatically report the new data in a J7.5 (ACT = 1) message.

Any JU clearing one or more of the special codes shall transmit the J7.5 (ACT = 3) message with the special code applicability indicator fields set and the associated special code fields set to value 0. e. instruction: What does the text say about the reporting responsibility for special codes?

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.6 (ACT = 0) message?
input: 4.7.7.8.1 FILTER IMPLEMENTATION REQUEST The J7.6 (ACT = 0) message is used by a JU to request that a filter be implemented by another JU. The implementation request consists of specifying the filter types and the parameters for each type and whether to filter inside or outside the defined area, with Filter Number field set to value 0. If specific filters have been prearranged, then an implementation request may consist of specifying the filter number with all Filter Indicator fields of the J7.6 (ACT = 0) set to value 0. 4.7.7.8.2 FILTER DESCRIPTION REPORT The J7.6 (ACT = 1) message is used by a JU to report a filter which the JU has inserted into its TDS or to respond to a J7.1 (ACT = 0) message.

instruction: What does the text say about filters in J7.6 messages?
input: b. Filters requested or reported in the J7.6 messages do not apply to any messages other than the J2, J3, and J12 (on Needline PG) series messages listed above, e.g., J2 series PPLI data for C[2] IUs, J6.0 Amplification data, J14.0 EW Parametric data, etc., except a simulation filter applies to C[2] IUs. c. Track filters shall be requested/reported in separate J7.6 messages from reference point and EW product filters, with the following exception: if in a track filter message the Unknown E/C Filter Indicator is set to value 1, then EW product data with Unknown E/C shall be filtered in addition to any other valid filter combination contained within that message.
output: Filters requested or reported in J7.6 messages do not apply to any messages other than the J2, J3, and J12 series messages listed above, except for a simulation filter which applies to C[2] IUs. Track filters shall be requested/reported in separate J7.6 messages from reference point and EW product filters, with the exception that if the Unknown E/C Filter Indicator is set to value 1 in a track filter message, then EW product data with Unknown E/C shall be filtered in addition to any other valid filter combination contained within that message.

instruction: What are valid combinations of filter indicators for tracks?
input: Valid combinations of filter indicators for tracks, together with their meanings, are given in Table 4.7-7.
output: Valid combinations of filter indicators for tracks are given in Table 4.7-7.

instruction: What does the text say about the use of filter indicators for reference points and EW product information?
input: ----- ###### d. Since reference points have no E/C or ID, point filters shall be requested/reported in separate J7.6 messages from tracks and EW product information, i.e., if the Reference Point Filter Indicator is set, the only other Filter Indicators that may be set are the SPI and Simulation Filter Indicators and, if required, a Geographic Area Filter. Valid combinations of filter indicators for reference points, together with their meanings, are given in Table 4.7-8. e. EW product information filters shall be requested/reported in separate J7.6 messages from tracks and points except that if the Unknown E/C filter is set, then Unknown EW product information are filtered regardless of the setting of the EW Filter Indicator. When the EW Filter Indicator is set, then all other Filter Indicators set in the same message apply only to EW product information data. Valid combinations of filter indicators for EW products, together with their meanings, are given in Table 4.7-9. f. If a Geographic Area Filter is set and the EW Filter Indicator is set, then all EW Fixes within/out the area and all EW AOPs having their center within/out the area and all EW LOBs with origin within/out the area are filtered. g. If a Geographic Area Filter is set and the Reference Point Filter Indicator is set, then all points within/out the area, all lines with all points within/out the area, and all areas completely within/out the area are filtered.
output: For reference points, if the Reference Point Filter Indicator is set, only the Simulation Filter Indicator and Geographic Area Filter may be set. Valid combinations of filter indicators for reference points, along with their meanings, are listed in Table 4.7-8. For EW product information, if the Unknown E/C filter is set, then all Unknown EW product information is filtered regardless of the setting of the EW Filter Indicator. When the EW Filter Indicator is set, all other Filter Indicators set in the same message apply only to EW product information data. Valid combinations of filter indicators for EW products, along with their meanings, are listed in Table 4.7-9. If a Geographic Area Filter is set and the EW Filter Indicator is set, all EW Fixes within or outside the area and all EW AOPs having their center within or outside the area and all EW LOBs with origin within or outside the area are filtered. If a Geographic Area Filter is set and the Reference Point Filter Indicator is set, all points within or outside the area, all lines with all points within or outside the area, and all areas completely within or outside the area are filtered.

instruction: What are moving filters specified using?

instruction: What should be reported for a TN if it is slaved to an existing TN?

instruction: What does the text say about using TN, Related instead of J7.6EO Latitude and Longitude?

instruction: What is the time of transmission for the J7.6 (ACT = 1) filter description report?

instruction: What is the initial filter description?

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.6 (ACT = 2) message?

instruction: What can a JU report with the J7.6 (ACT = 2) message?

instruction: What is the purpose of the J7.1 (ACT = 0) message?
